sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都表示"完整的，全部的，整个的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: entire, whole, complete, full, total, gross, all
means: entire ： 除了有whole的意思外，还强调既不能加一个也不减少一个的含义。
whole比entire更普通，强调每个组成部分都包括在内，无一漏掉或舍去。
complete ： 强调事物在内容、程度、或数量方面已完整，已达标准。
full ： 侧重指内容，含有能包括所有的充足内容的意味。
total与complete用法相近，但强调总量。
gross ： 侧重指未打折扣，未除去成本或皮重等与净重、净数相对。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"总数，全体"之意。
means: total ： 指总量之大，强调每一构成部分或成分均被计算在内。
sum ： 指两个或更多的数目相加的总和。
whole ： 着重其中没有部分或成分被忽略不计。

sentence.Network_en: The job losses will reduce the total workforce to 7,000.
sentence.Network_cn: 职位减少后，在职工人总数将减至7,000人。

sentence.Network_en: The total cost of the project would be more than $240 million.
sentence.Network_cn: 该项目的总成本会超过2.4亿美元。

sentence.Network_en: Each month the total prize kitty is £13.5 million.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个月的彩池奖金总额达1,350万英镑。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from medieval Latin totalis, from totum 'the whole', neuter of Latin totus 'whole, entire'. The verb, at first in the sense 'add up', dates from the late 16th cent

entry.def: A total is the number that you get when you add several numbers together or when you count how many things there are in a group.

example.ex: The companies have a total of 1,776 employees.
example.tran: 这些公司总计有 1,776 名员工。

entry.def: The total number or cost of something is the number or cost that you get when you add together or count all the parts in it.

example.ex: They said that the total number of cows dying from BSE would be twenty thousand…
example.tran: 他们说患疯牛病死亡的牛的总数将达 2 万头。

example.ex: The total cost of the project would be more than $240 million.
example.tran: 该项目的总成本会超过 2.4 亿美元。

entry.def: If there are a number of things in total, there are that number when you count or add them all together.

example.ex: I was with my husband for eight years in total...
example.tran: 我和丈夫在一起的时间总共有 8 年。

example.ex: In total, 45 per cent of adults in Britain are exposed to tobacco smoke at home.
example.tran: 英国总计有 45% 的成人在家里遭受到烟草烟雾的侵害。

entry.def: If several numbers or things total a certain figure, that figure is the total of all the numbers or all the things.

example.ex: The unit's exports will total $85 million this year...
example.tran: 该部门今年的出口总额将达 8,500 万美元。

example.ex: They will compete for prizes totalling nearly £3,000.
example.tran: 他们将为总额近 3,000 英镑的奖金展开争夺。

entry.def: When you total a set of numbers or objects, you add them all together.

example.ex: They haven't totalled the exact figures.
example.tran: 他们还没有对确切数据进行总计。

entry.def: You can use total to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.

example.ex: You were a total failure if you hadn't married by the time you were about twenty-three…
example.tran: 如果到了 23 岁左右还没结婚，你就是个彻底的失败者。

example.ex: There was an almost total lack of management control…
example.tran: 管理控制几乎是完全缺失的。

means.word_mean: 1. add up in number or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "Add all the people in this town to those of the neighboring town"

means.word_mean: 1. constituting the full quantity or extent; complete;

sentences.sentence: "an entire town devastated by an earthquake"

means.word_mean: 4. complete in extent or degree and in every particular;

Sentence.sentence: At the worst time, the total value of listed shares in American firms shrank by 57%.
The grand total over the 10 months they've lived in the three-bedroom house: $200.
The experience on Main Street stimulated self-improvement, and encouraged members to take pride in their home grounds and the total community.
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men
From December 1928 to December 1929, total household wealth declined only 3%.
Those who enjoy total freedom may not find themselves happy

sentences.en: Please figure out the total cost.
My efforts ended in total failure.
sentences.cn: 我的努力终归全盘失败。

sentences.en: A total of twenty people were[was] killed.

sentences.cn: 请计算一下全部支出是多少。

jushi.english: The work was a total success.
I find myself in almost total agreement with Tony.
jushi.chinese: 我发现自己的意见几乎完全与托尼一致。
